de.esoco.storage

Interface QueryResult<T>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, de.esoco.lib.manage.Closeable, org.obrel.core.Relatable

    public interface QueryResult<T>
extends de.esoco.lib.manage.Closeable, org.obrel.core.Relatable
    An interface that defines the methods for the iteration over the result of a storage query. A result set must be closed after it has been used. If the end of the result set is reached (i.e. FALSE is returned by hasNext() a query result instance will be closed automatically. Only if the reading from the result is stopped before the end is reached the close() method must be invoked explicitly. A query result is also closed automatically if the query by which it had been created is closed.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      boolean hasNext()
      Checks whether more objects are available in this query result.
      T next()
      Returns the next object from this query result.
      void setPosition(int nIndex, boolean bRelative)
      Sets the current position of this result.

      • Methods inherited from interface de.esoco.lib.manage.Closeable

      • Methods inherited from interface org.obrel.core.Relatable

    • Method Detail

      • hasNext

        boolean hasNext()
         throws StorageException
        Checks whether more objects are available in this query result. This method must be invoked before each call to the next() method, else the next result will be undetermined.
        Returns:
        TRUE if this result contains more objects
        Throws:
        StorageException - If determining the result state fails

      • next

        T next()
throws StorageException
        Returns the next object from this query result. A call to this method is only possible if the hasNext() method has been invoked before.
        Returns:
        The next object in this result
        Throws:
        StorageException - If retrieving the object data fails

      • setPosition

        void setPosition(int nIndex,
                 boolean bRelative)
        Sets the current position of this result. If the new position is valid (i.e. this method returns TRUE) the next call to next() will return the object at the given position. The index of the first object is 0. Negative index values will position the result from the end where -1 indicates the last object. A relative position of 0 corresponds to the current position, i.e. no change. The result will typically only be positioned on the designated record when the method hasNext() is invoked before querying the object at the given position with next().

        This is an optional operation which may not be supported by some implementations in which case an UnsupportedOperationException will be thrown. Some implementations may only support positive index values.

        Parameters:
        nIndex - The new position of this result set
        bRelative - TRUE to set the position relative to the current position, FALSE to set the absolute position
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - If positioning is not supported by the result implementation
